title: Electric force - 3 spheres 1 2 3 attract or repel

content.question:
A student has a collection of three small, insulating, charged spheres, Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and Sphere <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>. Each sphere is suspended by a string on an insulating stand and is either positively or negatively charged, but the student does not know which sphere has which charge. The student can bring any pair of spheres near each other and observe whether the electric force between the spheres is attractive or repulsive, as shown in the figure. Which of the following makes a correct prediction based on a possible observation?
ObservationPredictionASphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> attracts both Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and Sphere <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>.Spheres <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> will attract each other.BSphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> repels both Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and Sphere <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>.Spheres <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> will attract each other.CSpheres <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> attract each other.Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> will attract one of the other two spheres and repel the other one.DSpheres <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> repel each other.Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> will attract one of the other two spheres and repel the other.
